articles.author: Ellie Iorizzo
articles.summary: US avant-garde artist and musician Laurie Anderson said the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) is 'dismantling our world' as she reflected on the prospect of the technology being used to win a future war or election. She is currently working with a group in Toronto using AI to create imagery out of spoken language. Last year, Anderson revealed she was 'addicted' to using an AI text generator to emulate the words of her late husband Lou Reed.

articles.title: I asked ChatGPT to name the best S&P 500 growth stock and it picked this ...
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: ChatGPT has named the top growth stock in the S&P 500 according to the generative artificial intelligence (AI) tool. The company was chosen by ChatGPT based on the data it received from the tool. It was chosen because it is a growth stock.

articles.title: Wall Street Pepe, The Ultimate Intelligent Trading Tool as AI Agents Set to Be The ...
articles.author: Bitcoinist
articles.summary: AI is reshaping every industry, and crypto trading is no exception. AI agents are set to dominate the crypto landscape as we move into 2025, promising smarter and faster decision-making. Wall Street Pepe is not artificial intelligence, it's simply intelligence. It analyzes vast datasets and executes trades with precision.

articles.title: The AI illusion: Why most companies fail and how to succeed
articles.author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is heralded as a game-changer for businesses, promising revolutionary efficiency, innovation and transformation. However, most AI projects fall short of expectations and companies frequently fail to reach their expectations.    “A vast majority of AI projects fail to live up to expectations.

articles.title: MCQ showcases contributions to AI technologies in media, content creation
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Media City Qatar participated as a Key Partner with Al Jazeera Media Institute for the Al Jazeera Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Media held on January 11-12 in Doha. The conference featured dynamic panel discussions and workshops exploring AI's evolving role in journalism, content and media.

articles.title: AI is taking the US in a strange new direction
articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: In the last couple of months, I've encountered some diverse use cases for artificial intelligence (AI) that have me thinking differently about AI and its potential to remake the labour market in the short-term.    i.e. I've been sceptical that artificial intelligence will radically remake labour markets, because so much hype comes from the tech industry itself.

articles.title: Man used an AI to apply for 1,000 jobs– The outcome will surprise you!
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: A man employed a self-built AI bot to apply for 1,000 jobs while he slept and received 50 interview invitations over a month. The experiment highlights the growing role of artificial intelligence (AI) in job hunting and its potential to transform the application process.

articles.title: Xinhua Headlines: AI-driven innovations come to the fore at Las Vegas electronics show
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) took center stage at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2025. CES 2025 is the world's premier tech show running from Tuesday to January 12th in Las Vegas, Nevada.    "AI is advancing at an incredible pace"

articles.title: AIQ and Ecopetrol to support Colombia's energy transition
articles.author: GCC Business News
articles.summary: AIQ has signed a Strategic Collaboration Agreement with Ecopetrol to explore the deployment of AIQ's cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI) solutions in the Colombian national oil company's operations. AIQ is based in Abu Dhabi and developing innovative solutions for the energy sector.

articles.title: Opinion: Patrick van Esch and Yuanyuan Cui: How AI is redefining death, memory and immortality
articles.author: Daily Camera
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is offering people a new way to feel connected to a loved one after they're gone. It's a sort of AI chatbot trained digital data that can have something like a real connection to the deceased. It can be used to send messages to them.

articles.title: AI adding to fake reviews online. Here's how to spot them
articles.author: Madison
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence tools allow people to produce detailed online reviews with almost no work. Phony reviews have long plagued many popular websites. Watchdog groups and researchers say this has put merchants, service providers and consumers in uncharted territory, as they have previously been plagued by fake reviews.

articles.title: Qatar's first Arabic-centric LLM AI takes spotlight in ‘AI in Media' Conference, a conversation with Fanar
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: Fanar is Qatar's first Arabic-centric Large Language Model AI platform. It took the stage in the first day of Al Jazeera's second AI in Media Conference held on Saturday, Januarry 11, 2025. The session brought together experts and innovators from Qatar Computing Research Institute.

articles.title: US leadership in AI requires open-source diplomacy
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: When venture capitalist David Sacks takes office as the Trump administration's AI 'czar', he will face a thorny problem. China is developing capable AI models and sharing them openly. AI models are the reasoning engines that power tools like ChatGPT. If released openly, they could be useful to the U.S.

articles.title: Al Jazeera's ‘AI in Media' conference highlights future of journalism
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: Al Jazeera's second AI in Media Conference kicked off yesterday in Doha, Qatar. It's showcasing how technologies such as deep fakes, automated content creation and digital human assistants are reshaping media production. There are concerns about the ethical challenges that come with the powerful technology.

articles.title: It is OK to let children use ChatGPT for homework, says Science Secretary
articles.author: The Daily Telegraph
articles.summary: Kids can use ChatGPT to do their homework, according to the rules of the chat app. It's OK for kids to use it to do homework.      Â   in this case, it's okay for children to use chatGPT.

articles.title: UK to go ‘all-in' on AI as Starmer throws weight of Whitehall behind technology
articles.author: London Evening Standard
articles.summary: The Government is set to put more support into AI development in a bid to boost growth and cut costs. It is expected to increase funding for AI research and development in the next few years. It's hoped it will help cut costs and boost economic growth.

articles.title: Al Jazeera conference addresses challenges of AI use in media

articles.summary: The second edition of the Al Jazeera conference: AI in Media concluded on Sunday. The conference hosted in-depth discussions on the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in advancing the media industry. It was organised by the Al-Jazeera Media Institute and featured experts in media and technology.

articles.title: From ‘sovereign AI' to national security, the new strategy in full
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Matt Clifford is a tech entrepreneur and chair of the UK's Advanced Research and Invention Agency. He wants to make Britain a global hub for AI investment and innovation. He backs the potential of AI to grow the economy, improve lives for citizens and improve the quality of life.

articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence will boost Labour's growth plans and transform lives of ordinary people, Sir Keir Starmer will claim on Monday. The Prime Minister will adopt a 50-point 'action plan' for Britain to make the most of the technology. He wants to revive the economy.

articles.title: ‘AI can help solve global shortage of pathologists'
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: The hype cycle for AI is unrelenting. Most people's experience of AI is limited to ChatGPT or similar large language models churning out plagiarised student text.   It sometimes seems as though every second company is claiming its product is an 'artificial intelligence-driven solution' for a problem that nobody has.

articles.title: Steve Dempsey: If AI is really revolutionary, then why are all the products so lame?
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: If you believe the hype, artificial intelligence will change our lives in the near future, as some people claim.   Â. Â   i.e. the development of artificial intelligence is a subject of great hype and speculation in the media.

articles.summary: OpenAI's o3 system scored 85% on the ARC-AGI benchmark on December 20th, well above the previous AI best. Any shape with a protruding line will move to the end of that line and cover up any other shapes it overlaps with.

articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Nvidia enters the ASIC market to meet the growing demand for efficient AI inference chip solutions. It will sell ASICs to meet growing AI demand for AI inference chips in the form of chips with efficient ASICs for AI. It is also looking for partners in the ASICs market.

articles.title: Britain seeks to build homegrown rival to OpenAI in bid to become world leader in ...

articles.summary: The U.K. on Monday laid out plans to become a leader in AI, including ambitions to build a homegrown to global AI success stories like OpenAI, which is based in London, and to build its own AI-related industry.

articles.title: Rachel Reeves using AI to reply to Treasury emails
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Rachel Reeves has started using artificial intelligence to reply to emails using new software rolled out by the Treasury. Ministers and MPs have increasingly turned to AI to manage inboxes swollen by messages from the public and interested groups, and to provide fast, personalised responses to them.

articles.title: Smarter, Faster, Better: How AI is Revolutionizing Digital Classrooms In Online Schools
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has reshaped every facet of modern life. It is at the heart of a significant transformation in education, particularly in online schools. With the global rise of online education, AI's role in enhancing the student is becoming more important.

articles.title: UK to ‘unleash' AI to turbocharge economy
articles.author: Newstalk ZB
articles.summary: Keir Starmer is due today to outline an action plan to make the UK 'the world leader' in artificial intelligence and spark Britain's flagging economy. His Labour administration said AI would be 'unleashed' across the whole of the country with the 'full weight' of the civil service.

articles.title: Tony Blair and William Hague: Our focus on AI must be relentless
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is driving the fastest technological and scientific revolution in human history. It's the productivity tools businesses use to speed up routine tasks, the programmes that spot cancer in hospital scans twice as fast, and the facial recognition software that helps the police catch violent criminals.

articles.title: Tech minister Peter Kyle says children should be allowed to use AI to do their ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Peter Kyle says children should be allowed to use AI to do their homework. He claims ChatGPT can generate entire essays and answer maths and science questions if supervised, as well as answering questions from the text book.    for children to use chat-based tools.

articles.title: Prime Minister sets out blueprint to turbocharge AI (British Prime Minister's Office)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: AI will help turbocharge growth and boost living standards. Public sector will spend less time doing admin and more time delivering the services working people need. AI Growth Zones will speed up planning for AI infrastructure costing £14 billion and 13,250 jobs committed by private leading tech.

articles.title: "Didn't Recognise Him": Whistleblower Suchir Balaji's Mother Slams OpenAI
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: Suchir Balaji's mother has accused OpenAI of not recognising her son's contributions to their flagship product, ChatGPT. She spoke to an influencer on X and accused them of failing to recognise his contributions.   Â

articles.title: ‘Mainlined into UK's veins': Labour announces huge public rollout of AI
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Keir Starmer will launch a plan to increase 20-fold the amount of artificial intelligence in the UK. There is widespread public fear about the technology's effects on society, but there will be a multibillion-pound investment in UK's computing capacity.

articles.title: AI technologies contribution to economic development highlighted
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has potential to drive efficiency, innovation, and growth across the economy. Coordinator to Federal Tax Ombudsman Saif Ur Rehman believes in AI's potential to boost economy's efficiency and growth. Ur Rehan: AI is an important tool for tax administration.

articles.title: 7 Game-Changing AI Chrome Extensions to Supercharge Your Productivity

articles.summary: The future of productivity lies in AI-powered Chrome extensions. ChatGPT has revolutionized AI, but these tools integrate seamlessly into your browser. articles.title: Qatar Airways' Sama becomes world's first digital human cabin crew to debut on social media
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: Sama is the first AI-powered digital human cabin crew. She will be the face of Qatar Airways' innovation on Instagram. Her account, @SamaOnTheMove, will offer followers a mix of travel tips and personal stories from her.

articles.title: UK must not let AI ‘wash over our economy', says Science Secretary
articles.author: AOL
articles.summary: Peter Kyle is set to launch the Government's plans for AI on Monday. He will set out how the UK will encourage tech and how it will help the economy.      .   for the first time, the Science Secretary has said the UK cannot let AI 'wash over our economy and pick up the pieces afterwards'
